sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  

const layoutProps = {
  
};
export default class MDXContent extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props)
    this.layout = null
  }
  render() {
    const { components, ...props } = this.props

    return <MDXTag
             name="wrapper"
             
             components={components}><MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"-sprucebot-skills-kit-"}}>{`🌲 Sprucebot Skills Kit 🌲`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"skills.md"}}>{`Skills`}</MDXTag>{` <- Start here after reading below`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"server.md"}}>{`Server`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"interface.md"}}>{`Interface`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"api.md"}}>{`Core API`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"user.md"}}>{`User`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"meta.md"}}>{`Meta`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"events.md"}}>{`Events`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"lang.md"}}>{`Lang`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"messages.md"}}>{`Messages`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"errors.md"}}>{`Errors`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"training.md"}}>{`Training`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"uploads.md"}}>{`Uploading Files`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"cache.md"}}>{`Caching`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul"><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"audit.md"}}>{`Audit Logs`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"wtf"}}>{`WTF?`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`This is a highly opinionated approach on how to rapidly build skills for Sprucebot. Ultimately, you could build a skill on any stack. 🤘🏼 This particular kit uses NodeJS + ReactJS with Next + Koa as supporting frameworks... May the force be with you.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"technical-requirements"}}>{`Technical requirements`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`node v7.6+ : Koa requires node v7.6.0 or higher for ES2015 and async function support.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Yarn is installed (you can use NPM if you really want)`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
           </MDXTag>
  }
}
MDXContent.isMDXComponent = true
